p: Lipophilic extracts were obtained according to the method reported in the literature [ 9]. Fresh, oven-dried, and freeze-dried fruit bodies of black morel were cut into small parts (1.0 ± 0.5 cm) and transferred into the flask with freshly distilled petroleum ether (30–60 °C). The flasks were placed in a dark and shady place for one week at room temperature. The petroleum ether layers were separated and dried by anhydrous Na 2SO 4, then recovered the solvents in a vacuum to afford lipophilic extracts. All three extracts were stored at 4 °C in the refrigerator for further use.
